page.title: 05East Hagbourne - Attitudes
page.content: The overriding reason why people like East Hagbourne is that it is quiet and also friendly. Many also like the fact that it is within the countryside and houses are attractive. On the subject of future improvements E. Hagbourne divides into two distinct sections-the council bungalows and maisonettes to the north, housing mainly elderly people, and the more affluent inhabitants of the period and detached homes that predominate the remainder. The former group would like to see a bus stop nearer than the Blewbury road and improved shopping facilities while the rest are more concerned with village appearance - grass cutting, vandalism, litter etc. Issues that link both sections are the provision of a lollipop lady for the primary school and the wish to remain distinct from Didcot.
